thread.title: South Korea police reportedly name Samsung Chairman Lee as suspect for tax evasion

author: Seong Joon Cho
title: South Korea police reportedly name Samsung Chairman Lee as suspect for tax evasion
text:
South Korea police reportedly name Samsung Chairman Lee as suspect for tax evasion Published 15 Hours Ago Seong Joon Cho | Bloomberg | Getty Images Lee Kun Hee, chairman of Samsung Group. 
South Korean police named Samsung Electronics Chairman Lee Kun-hee as a suspect over allegations that he used bank accounts held in someone else's name that held some 400 billion won ($368 million), Yonhap News Agency said on Thursday. 
Lee was suspected of tax evasion, Yonhap added. 
Samsung declined comment and police were not immediately available for comment. 
Lee has been hospitalized after suffering a heart attack in 2014. Related Securities
